subject: Management
title: Free Rider Problem
description: A 60-second lesson on Free Rider Problem.

hook.text: One team member contributed nothing to the group project. The rest covered for them to meet the deadline.

buildup.text: Free riders benefit from the team's output without contributing their fair share.

discovery.text: When free riding is tolerated, it demoralizes productive members who feel exploited.

twist.text: The problem isn't always laziness. Sometimes roles and expectations are just unclear.

climax.text: Fix it with visible individual contributions, peer accountability, and direct conversations.

punchline.text: Address free riding fast. Tolerance breeds more of it.

quiz.question: What is the main danger of tolerating free riders on a team?
options: It demoralizes productive members who feel exploited
It has no effect as long as the work gets done
Free riders eventually start contributing on their own
